title: More effective logic needed for processing disk sorting with border values for row values

When sorting on disk with 40000 rows of data and the program is set to process data less than 40000, the software performs the following operations:

SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Sort 40000 rows of data on disk.
2. Set the program to process data less than 40000.
3. Observe the following operations: 
   a. Save the file as a temporary file.
   b. Load the file into memory.
   c. Perform sorting on the data.
   d. Save the sorted data to the temporary file.
